articles.title: Facebook Tests Reactions and Dislike Button on Messages
articles.description: Facebook has made a dislike button available to a limited number of Messenger users on a trial basis. If successful, the dislike feature could later be rolled out to all Messenger users. Significantly, a dislike feature continues to be unavailable in Facebookâ€™s News Feed, despite its much-requested status among users. The company has indicated that adding a dislike option to its currently available reactions, rolled out in expanded form about a year ago, could create too much negativity in News Feed.

articles.title: 22 Tips for SEOs to Attract More Twitter Followers
articles.description: Twitter is at once simple and complicated. The 140-character means of interacting with the world seems simple, but understanding how to use it effectively as part of your marketing strategy can be less straightforward. This article outlines 22 ways to create an engaging Twitter account that attracts loyal followers. The key, the article points out, is to craft original and unique content and make sure it gets in front of the right people.

articles.title: Google Launches Location Extension Display Ads for Local Businesses
articles.description: Google recently launched a new display ad format on the Google Display Network. The new format shows photos, store location, and business hours. This change comes in response to a finding by Google that more than half of people who clicked into the extended info section were looking for directions or more information about a store location.
